title: Bug 12398: Accessibility problems
description: When accessing the Help view, I need to first click on one of the interactive areas (such as the banner with the tool buttons, the navigation frame, or the content frame) before it becomes functional. This behavior is observed on Windows 2000 (Win2K) with the version 20020326. The tab key, specifically, does not have any effect.
OB: When I launch the Help view, the tab key does not have any interactive functionality.
EB: The Help view should be accessible and navigable via the keyboard immediately upon launching it.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the application or system.
2. Navigate to the Help view.
3. Verify if the tab key works as expected. It should be instantly navigable via the keyboard without requiring any prior mouse click on an interactive area of the Help view.
